meanings.definition: To cause to hold or exhibit a particular bias; to influence in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: She was biasing the results of the experiment to favor her hypothesis.
meanings.sent2: The news article was biasing the readers towards a specific political view.
meanings.sent3: The magician was biasing the audience's perception with his clever tricks.
meanings.sent4: The artist was biasing the colors in the painting to create a dramatic effect.
meanings.sent5: The coach was biasing the team's strategy to focus on defense.

meanings.definition: The act of giving a bias to; the act of influencing in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The biasing of the survey questions led to skewed results.
meanings.sent2: Her subtle biasing of the conversation towards her own achievements was noticeable.
meanings.sent3: The biasing of the scale made her weigh lighter than she actually was.
meanings.sent4: The biasing of the jury members affected the outcome of the trial.
meanings.sent5: The biasing of the compass needle caused navigation errors.
